metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22823 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
build_model in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3 has aninteger overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22823` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.5-3ubuntu0.4
libexpat1 - 2.2.5-3ubuntu0.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

firefox - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

libxmltok1 - 1.2-4ubuntu0.18.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.5-3ubuntu0.4').
xmlrpc-c package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
vnc4 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
coin3 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
libxmltok package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-4ubuntu0.18.04.1~esm1').
